title: Microsoft Ships Urgent Fixes for Critical Flaws in Windows Kerberos, Hyper-V
description:
Patch Tuesday: Redmond patches critical, remote code execution vulnerabilities haunting Windows Kerberos and Windows Hyper-V.

The post Microsoft Ships Urgent Fixes for Critical Flaws in Windows Kerberos, Hyper-V appeared first on SecurityWeek.

title: Delinea Acquires Authomize to Tackle Identity-Based Threats
description:
Delinea acquires Israeli startup Authomize to add identity threat detection and response (IDTR) technologies to its product portfolio.

The post Delinea Acquires Authomize to Tackle Identity-Based Threats appeared first on SecurityWeek.

title: CISA Warns of Apache Superset Vulnerability Exploitation
description:
CISA has added a critical-severity Apache Superset flaw (CVE-2023-27524) to its Known Exploited Vulnerabilities catalog.

The post CISA Warns of Apache Superset Vulnerability Exploitation appeared first on SecurityWeek.

title: Adobe Patches Code Execution Flaws in Substance 3D Stager
description:
Patch Tuesday: Adobe patches six security flaws in the Substance 3D Stager product and warned of code execution risks on Windows and macOS.

The post Adobe Patches Code Execution Flaws in Substance 3D Stager appeared first on SecurityWeek.

title: Siemens, Schneider Electric Release First ICS Patch Tuesday Advisories of 2024
description:
Industrial giants Siemens and Schneider Electric publish a total of 7 new security advisories addressing 22 vulnerabilities. 

The post Siemens, Schneider Electric Release First ICS Patch Tuesday Advisories of 2024 appeared first on SecurityWeek.

title: Turkish Hackers Target Microsoft SQL Servers in Americas, Europe
description:
Researchers at Securonix warn that Turkish threat actors are targeting organizations in the Americas and Europe with ransomware campaigns.

The post Turkish Hackers Target Microsoft SQL Servers in Americas, Europe appeared first on SecurityWeek.

title: Continuity in Chaos: Applying Time-Tested Incident Response to Modern Cybersecurity
description:
Despite the drastically newer and more complex technology, many of the core incident response principles remain the exact same and we should never forget the fundamentals.

The post Continuity in Chaos: Applying Time-Tested Incident Response to Modern Cybersecurity appeared first on SecurityWeek.

title: Bosch Nutrunner Vulnerabilities Could Aid Hacker Attacks Against Automotive Production Lines
description:
Hackers can take complete control of Bosch Rexroth nutrunners, installing ransomware or altering settings to cause financial impact and brand damage.

The post Bosch Nutrunner Vulnerabilities Could Aid Hacker Attacks Against Automotive Production Lines appeared first on SecurityWeek.

title: LoanDepot Takes Systems Offline Following Ransomware Attack
description:
Mortgage lending firm LoanDepot has disclosed a cyberattack resulting in data encryption and system disruptions.

The post LoanDepot Takes Systems Offline Following Ransomware Attack appeared first on SecurityWeek.

title: Ransomware Gang Claims Attack on Capital Health
description:
The LockBit ransomware gang claims to have stolen over 7 terabytes of data from hospital system Capital Health.

The post Ransomware Gang Claims Attack on Capital Health appeared first on SecurityWeek.

title: Cybersecurity Funding Dropped 40% in 2023: Analysis
description:
The volume of cybersecurity transactions increased in 2023 compared to 2022, but the total amount of funding decreased significantly.

The post Cybersecurity Funding Dropped 40% in 2023: Analysis appeared first on SecurityWeek.
